item.title: Alucinara Gateways
item.description: Alucinara Gateways are used by Realm-Hoppers in order to travel between realms, although most people do not due to the danger of an unfamiliar world - Realm Hoppers often tend to be miners, scientists and bandits.

item.title: Alucinarium
item.description: Alucinarium, also referred to as Alu’, is a crystalline metallic element and the source of all alucinara magic. It can generate thermal energy, kinetic energy, gravitational potential energy, light, and many more unknown phenomena - all with minimal to no input.

item.title: Central-Continent
Cultures Portal
item.description: 2nd Realm Central Continent Morelland Proto-Morellic Modern Morellic Sarvara Sarvaran Sarvaran Poetry Empire of the Petrified Child Stonechild-imperial Snixia Proto-Snixian

item.title: Disaster Frequency
item.description: the disaster frequency in a high-pitched tone that happens during tragedies. (work on this a bit more)

item.title: Empire of the Petrified Child
item.description: Culture Stonechild Imperial culture was heavily influenced by the mythology surrounding the Petrified Child (Stonechild Imperial: Äryýsh, from Proto-Morellic *Asteihar) Thus, religion was a big factor in the workings of society.

item.title: Food
item.description: See Also Thirrists

item.title: G’athre
item.description: G’athre (Proto-Neth: /ɠáθɾɛθ/ Plural: G’athreth /ɠáθɾɛθ/) are small poisonous amphibians of the equatorial rainforest of the 2nd realm. Morphology They are tetrapodal, exhibit fortuitary glands, and have 4 “nostrils” on each side of their spine, totalling 8.

item.title: Infra-essence and Ultra-Essence
item.description: Infra-essence and Ultra-essence are the names given to the phenomena of places, objects, and entities existing within the many realms of Alucinara.

item.title: Kempton Moss
item.description: Kempton Moss, born in 65 YA, was notably the founder of the Afortuitites, and a hermit of the -3rd Realm.

item.title: Languages
item.description: See Also Minikin Proto-Morellic Sarvaran Sarvaran Poetry Stonechild Imperial Modern Morellic Proto-Snixian Demi-Slug Proto-Kpavan

item.title: Longleaf
item.description: Longleaf trees have been a favourite for nest building even during the time of the Proto-Morellic culture in 7,000YA.1 Morphology Their leaves hang from the branches, featuring a coiling tendril which eventually widens to a long banner-like leaf which tapers into a point.

item.title: Minikin
item.description: Morphology Minikin, native to The 2nd Realm, have tails, fairly long yet anthropoid digitigrade feet, and small snouts. It is said that the rest of their features were modified by Lwubo, the deity of love and fertility, to be anthropoid in shape.

item.title: Morellic Culture
item.description: The Morellic culture existed at around 7,000YA. The culture began as the two tribes, Rhohita and Cervina, met. Language Proto-morellic was the language spoken by the early morellic culture.

item.title: Music
item.description: Over the course of my creation of Alucinara, I have also made music, such as; Secrets of the Peeking Light Pts.

item.title: Neth River Civilisation
item.description: The Neth River Civilisation existed in 7,000 YA. Location The NRC (Neth River Civilisation) was located along the Neth River, which flowed from the Nessaui lake into the Sarvaran Gulf.

item.title: Phantasmarrhoea
Proto-Kpavan
item.description: Proto-Kpavan Proto-Kpavan: /bɔˈwiː ˈk͡pɐː.ʋɐ/ was spoken in 6,000YA by the equatorial Demi-Slug peoples. Phonology Consonants Consonants Labial Alveolar Palatal Velar Glottal Nasal m m̩ n n̩ ŋ ŋ̩ Plosive p b t d k g k͡p g͡b ʔ Fricative f s x Approx.

item.title: Proto-Morellic
item.description: Proto-Morellic1 was spoken in 8,000 YA by the Morellic Minikin2, in the 2nd Realm’s Etavi Peninsula3. Phonology Consonants Consonants Labial Coronal Dorsal Laryngeal Plosive p b bʱ t d dʱ k g gʱ Fricative f v s z x ɣ h Sonorant m mʱ n nʱ l ŋ ŋʱ Vowels Vowels Front Central Back High i u Mid e o Low ä Proto-Morellic: Salanh Dalichu /sä.

item.title: Proto-Neth
item.description: Proto-Neth was spoken in 7,000YA by the Nethian minikin. Grammar Word Order Proto-Neth word order was generally free, but the verb almost always stayed in between the subject and object.

item.title: Proto-Rotanythi
item.description: Consonants Labial Coronal Dorsal Plosive p, b, pʰ (ph) t, d, tʰ (th) k, g, kʰ (kh) Fricative f, v s, z x (h) Nasal m n Sonorant l, r, j (y) Vowels Front Central Back High i u Mid e ə (y) o Low a Consonants Labial Coronal Retroflex Dorsal Plosive p, b, pː (pp) t, d, tː (tt) ʈ͡ʂ (tr), ɖ͡ʐ (dr), ʈ͡ʂː (ttr) k, g, kː (kk) Fricative f, v s, z ʂ (sr), ʐ (zr) x Nasal m n Sonorant l, r Vowels Front Central Back High i u Mid e o Low a

item.title: Proto-Snixian
item.description: Proto-Snixian Proto-Snixian: /t͡ʃé:sòn épā:ɫìç/ was spoken in 8,500YA by the Proto-Snixian Minikin. It acted as the progenitor of the Snixian Languages.

item.title: Proto-Tsrawi
item.description: Proto-Tsrawi Proto-Tsrawi: /t͡sʼr̥äʋi pʼinä r̥in͡tä xu/1 was spoken in 10,000YA by a Minikin population in the modern-day Morellic Mountains. They are one of the first known communities to have existed.

item.title: Ram's Head Migration
item.description: Ram’s Head Migration is the name given to the Morellic cultural practice of placing babies in shelters built atop of the antlers of sheep.

item.title: Rats
item.description: Rats are a group of animals in the Rodentia family.

item.title: Realms
item.description: What the scientists of our time fail to understand is that we reside in a tide pool. The tide hasn’t returned to us in millenia, but we still see the ripples created by those whom travel across the pools.

item.title: Sarvara
item.description: The Sarvaran Civilisation existed around 7,000YA, and spoke Sarvaran. Notable People Hastini the Elephant Hastini the Elephant Sarvaran: Hestį́da /xesˈtĩ́.da/ was a Sarvaran general who was known to wear a copper elephant mask over his mouth.

item.title: Sarvaran
item.description: Sarvaran Sarvaran: /sɑˈʋɑ́.ɾa/ was spoken in 6,500YA1 in the Sarvaran Civilisation by Minikin. It descended from Proto-Morellic and so is part of the Morellic Language Family.

item.title: Sarvaran Music
item.description: Instruments The Rainslug The Rainslug (Sarvaran: Oveýsllea /ɔˈʋéý̯s.ɬea̯/) was originally a children’s toy made of many hollow hemispheres linked by ball-and-socket joints, taking an appearance reminiscent of a slug.

item.title: Sayä
item.description: Sayä is a plant of the equatorial rainforest of the 2nd-realm which features small pink flowers. Predators The Flowers are sought after by Minikin, Demislugs, and small rodents due to their high concentration of nutrients.

item.title: Sheep
item.description: Sheep, originally native to the 0th Realm, are caprines. Since their conception, they have spread to many infra-essent and ultra-essent realms, and diverged from their ancestors.

item.title: Sheep Monkeys
item.description: Sheep Monkeys are small mammals, related to earth goats (Capra aegagrus). They resemble Caprines, hence their name. Biology Habitat Unlike 0th Realm Caprines, Sheep Monkeys live in trees.

item.title: Silkvine
item.description: Silkvine is a plant native to the Central Continent of 2°e. Silk The Silkvine is named for the fact that the undersides of their leaves are the preferred shelter of Threadgrubs, one of the most accessible source of silk.

item.title: Stonechild Imperial
item.description: Stonechild Imperial was spoken in the Empire of the Petrified Child by Minikin. It descended from Sarvaran and so is part of the Morellic Language Family.

item.title: The Murder of Florifera Moss
item.description: The murder of Florifera Moss, wife to Kempton Moss, took place in 6YA at the community of Lichenia after Kempton became delusional with the need for eternal life.

item.title: Thirrists
item.description: Thirrists are small tri-segmented citrus fruits of the realm of 2°e. Growth Thirrist Plants start out as 1 of 3 seeds contained in the centre of a Thirrist fruit and, once in the ground, begin to germinate - eventually becoming short, wide trees.
